Detailed Description

Represents a specific row of a provider. The provider and the columnids that represents text and icon has to be specified. Additionally, it can be defined, if the provider should be observed or not. If the provider is not observed, the represented row always stays the same and no notification is done, when the data of the provider row changes. Such items are e.g. used by the ProviderProxyContainer. Each ProviderProxyItem just represents a fixed provider row and the notification is handled by the ProviderProxyContainer If the provider is observed, the attached row always represents the originally specified row. A notification is done, in case the provider data representing text and icon changes. This means that if a new row is inserted to the provider, which is smaller than the observed row, the observed row is increased, to make sure that always the same data is represented. In case the observed row gets deleted, the row is set to c_no_row and the ProviderProxyItem> is set to invalid. The observed row is decreased, if a row smaller then the observed row is deleted. The provider is observed per default.

) 
 

Parameters:
provider Provider containing the row to be represented
row Represented row, can be defined after initialization by calling SetProviderRow
text_id Columnid of the provider representing the text of the ProviderProxyItem can be defined after construction by calling SetItemColumnIds
icon_id Columnid of the provider representing the icon of the ProviderProxyItem can be defined after construction by calling SetItemColumnIds
obs_prov Specifies if the provider should be observed or not. Per default the provider is observed.

)  const

data_id Columnid of the provider, specifying the column from which the data should be retrieved

const ImageObtainer & ProviderProxyItem::GetIcon (  const IconState &  icon_state  )  const [virtual]
 

Parameters:
icon_state@see Gui/Item
Returns:
Icon specified by the provider for the defined row and columnid. The provider is only accessed, if the icon has been invalidated before, see InvalidateIcon If no invalidation was done, it is assumed that the data of the provider did not change. Hence, Base::GetIcon is returned.

Reimplemented from Item.

const WString & ProviderProxyItem::GetText (   )  const [virtual]
 

Returns:
Text specified by the provider for the defined row and columnid. The provider is only accessed, if the text has been invalidated before, see InvalidateText If no invalidation was done, it is assumed that the data of the provider did not change. Hence, Base::GetText is returned.
